newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends up in kerb, seen volatile.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends up in kerb, seen volatile.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.06 up at 42.64 to the dollar in the kerb market on Tuesday amid a rise in supply of the U.S. currency and is likely to rise further on Wednesday, dealers said.
They said the market was directionless at present and might remain volatile because of uncertain political and economic situations in the country.

The State Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 rupees to the dollar. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 6.50 percent compared to Monday's 6.70 percent. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
